_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:51 using v2.1
title: How has the number of managerial staff in the NHS changed over time?
analysis_commentary: Contrary to popular opinion there has been a substantial decrease in the number of managers employed within the NHS, from an average of 30,067 in 2009-10 to 24,054 in 2013-14. There has been a similar decline in the number of senior managers, from 13,228 in 2009-10 to 10,524. When taken together, this represents a 20% fall in the number of managers within the health service.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
